Quick Help

- Objects: Try LOOK AT..., SPEAK TO..., TAKE..., DROP..., OPEN..., GIVE... TO..., USE... ON/WITH...
- Inventory: See which items you are carrying by typing I, INV or INVENTORY.
- Moving around: Press the compass buttons, or type GO NORTH, SOUTH, E, GO TO...
- Shortcuts: Press the up arrow and down arrow to scroll through commands you have already typed in. Try X... as a shortcut for LOOK AT...

game.name: The Bony King Of Nowhere
game.description:
You are a citizen of the land of Nowhere, and you are given an urgent letter to deliver to the King. Navigate your way through the strange and twisted landscape to the capital city of Lost and gain access to the King's castle.

*****type 'hints' at any time for instructions and help******
game.author: Luke A. Jones

verb.name: k10
verb.defaultexpression: "You can't cut; chop; chop down; cut up; chop up " + object.article + "."

command.name: k13
command.script:
msg ("
Greetings adventurer, and a warm welcome to my game!

OK, let's try and point you in the right direction.

The object of the game is explore the world, its objects and its characters through typing in commands.

The basic commands you can use are listed below, but there are many others you can use, part of the fun of a text adventure is finding new actions that you can perform, some are crucial to solving puzzles:

'Look' Returns a description of the room you are in (which will sometimes change if you have done an action so worth checking often). Room descriptions often contain items that can be taken, (use 'take', or 'get'), normally you need to take an object before you can use it.

'Examine' and 'Look at' perform the same action (or you can just type x as a shortcut) and should return a description for example 'examine chest' or 'x chest' would both return a description of the item. People can be examined as well as objects.

'Open' some objects are containers and need to be opened to reveal the contents.

'Use': some items can be used, e.g. use lamp, other items need a specific verb, for example 'eat apple' might work where 'use apple' will not as it's too vague.

'Ask' you can ask characters about objects or people, e.g. 'Ask miller about windmill', sometimes they will have something to say about it, other times not.

'Give' you can try giving objects to people who might want them. To do this name the object before the person, e.g. give object X to person Y (give person Y object X won't work for tedious logic reasons!)

'Inventory' or 'Inv' show what you are carrying, you can examine objects whether you are carrying them or not.

Unlike some text adventures, not all items that are in a room are listed as you enter, but they may be mentioned in the room description instead.

Some responses and descriptions in the game contain clues to solve the game, others are simply there to add atmosphere or humour. If you are stuck try performing an action that you would do if you were really in the situation described.

The English language is a beautiful but fickle beast, so if a command you type does not work,its sometimes worth trying to say it it a different way

Lastly I have designed this game so you can't die, also it's not possible for you to perform an action which makes the game unsolvable. However if you want to undo an action just type 'undo'.

If you are stuck for a long time and need a hint email me: luke.jones@gmail.com.

Good Luck!
")

object.name: Northern Meadow
object.description:
msg ("
You are in the meadow outside your hovel, several acres of wild grassland and wild flowers. You may be dirt poor, but the beauty of the landscape is some consolation.")

object.name: wild flowers
object.look: There is a multitude of beautiful wild flowers, bowing gently in the breeze
object.takemsg: You decide to leave the flowers for the visiting bees to enjoy

object.name: player
object.look: You are thin and your skin is grimy, you are wearing grey ragged woollen clothing
object.attr: You are thin and your skin is grimy, you are wearing grey ragged woollen clothing
You are thin and your skin is grimy, you are wearing ragged grey woollen clothing

object.name: Letter
object.look:
The letter is addressed to the Bony King of Nowhere, at his palace in the capital Lost, many miles to the south.

On the reverse is written;

"If found please deliver personally to the King, the contents are confidential and you are forbidden from reading them. Failure to comply with either of these requests will result in summary execution."

Well that's just perfect you think, you've always hated a) the capital, b) the monarchy, and c) the south in general.
object.dropmsg: remembering the threat of execution you decide not to drop the letter
object.read: You're dying to know what's in the letter, but the instructions written on it forbid you from doing so. You can examine it.
object.openmsg: You can't open it, the King will have you killed!

object.name: Dylan
object.look: It's your faithful canine companion, he's an ageing Boxer mongrel of some sort, he has tan brown fur with a white patch on his chest. He's seen a few too many scrapes and doesn't smell too sweet, but you love him dearly and he's called Dylan.
object.takemsg: You don't need to carry him, he'll follow you anywhere
object.speak: Dylan looks up to you and barks excitedly
object.hack: He's your only friend in the world, you'd never hurt him

object.name: Southern Meadow
object.description: You are in the Southern Meadow, on the edge of the Northern Woods

object.name: fallen tree
object.look: It's a fallen poplar tree, looks like it got too top heavy and was ripped down by the wind
object.takemsg: It's far too heavy!

object.name: apple
object.eatmsg: you nibble a bit of the apple, but fruit isn't really your thing
object.eat: You detest fruit so you decide to not eat the apple
object.throw: You throw the apple, as soon as it's in the air Dylan is off like a shot, he catches it and returns it to you
object.look: A medium sized apple of the Cox's variety, it is mottled green and red.

giveto.item:
msg ("You place the apple in the flat palm of your hand and offer it up to the horse. Its lips tickle your hand as it picks it up, it munches it noisily. You smell the tart tang of the apple as it's masticated.

The horse eyes you and gently snorts. You've made a friend.") SetObjectFlagOn (Horse, "mates") RemoveObject (apple)

object.name: Logs
object.look: Four body-length sized logs from a poplar tree
object.takemsg: You pick them up, they're not heavy
object.dropmsg: The four logs strike the ground making a rhythm..a log-a-rhythm

selfuseon.item: msg ("The logs are too short and too weak to span the gap in the bridge")

object.name: Woodland Clearing
object.description: A clearing in the wood, looks like it was once a small holding. There is a carpet of thyme underfoot that releases a sweet tang into the air as you walk across it.

object.name: Ruined hovel
object.hack: It's already ruined

object.name: Broken fishing rod
object.look: A bamboo fishing rod, with a cork handle. It has a line and hook, but the reel is seized with rust.

giveto.item:
msg ("
\"Ah, haven't seen this model in years, a real classic in its day. I can fix it for you, but I need a favour in return. Can you take this sack of wheat to the Windmill and have it milled for me please?\"

The Tinker hands you a sack of wheat") AddToInventory (Sack of Wheat) RemoveObject (Broken fishing rod)

object.name: Mug
object.look: An old brown clay mug, chipped on the rim. On the side it reads 'Mug puns are tea-dious'

object.name: thyme
object.look: A powerful herb, Mussolini made the trains run on this stuff
object.takemsg: You decide to leave the thyme undisturbed, it would be a waste
object.hack: You decide to leave the thyme undisturbed, it would be a waste

object.name: Broken Bridge
object.look: A wooden footbridge, which has collapsed in the middle leaving a yawning gap down to the dangerous river below. What a terrible thing to happen, you can't get over it.
object.jump: You take a run up to the bridge, but as you approach the gap you realise you'll never make it, and just manage to stop in time. You retreat to the safety of the riverbank.

object.twist: Nice idea, but you lack the skill to make them into something useful
object.hack: You need them whole

object.look: The River Void is fast, deep and wide. The water level is unusually high and it is roaring loudly as it flows past. It looks like the bridge across has collapsed. On the edge of the riverbank there are a thick beds of reeds.

object.name: Windmill scenery
Your Hovel
object.description:
You are in your hovel in the northernmost borderlands of the Kingdom of Nowhere.

It is a round wattle and daub hut. There is a fireplace in the middle with a hole in the thatch roof above it acting as a chimney.

Around the circumference of the room there are a few sticks of furniture and rags that represent the totality of your worldly possessions.

(type 'hints' for game specific help at anytime)

object.name: fireplace
object.light: You could rekindle the fire but you decide not to as you are low on fuel, besides you need to get out and about

object.name: furniture
object.look: Furniture might be a rather grand term what consists of a filthy straw bed and a battered wooden chest

object.name: Straw Bed
object.look: Several large rectangular bales of hay lashed together, it is blackened with grime and splattered with mud
object.takemsg: It's too heavy to carry
object.hack: That would be axe-zessive!

object.name: Rags
object.hack: That would be axe-zessive!

giveto.item:
msg ("
\"Hmm, this was nice cloth once upon a time, but it's too far gone for me to do anything with, sorry\" He hands the rags back to you.")

object.name: stones
object.look: A circle of flat whetstones bearing heavy scratch marks.
object.takemsg: You don't want to carry these around!

object.name: roof
object.look: The circular roof is made from straw thatch, with a small hole in the centre to let out the smoke from the fire

object.name: hole
object.look: A small hole in the centre of the roof, you made it to let out the smoke from the fire

object.name: scratch marks
object.look: Heavy scratch marks made from the repetitive action of sharpening tools

object.name: Shovel
object.look: A small wooden shovel that you use for removing ashes. It's a ground-breaking design.

object.name: Battered Wooden Chest
object.look: An ancient wooden chest that has been repeatedly patched and repaired. You'll be pleased to know there is no lock.
object.takemsg: It's too heavy to carry around

object.name: Blunt Axe
object.dropmsg: You drop the useful looking axe, a wise move I'm sure
object.look: An axe with an arms length wooden haft and a steel head with the letter L and the pattern of a rose embossed on it. It is your prized (and only) possession given to you by your father. It's blade is a sharp as Jack after a busy day.

selfuseon.item: msg ("You swing your axe at the fallen tree, but is too blunt to chop it. ")

object.name: hay
object.takemsg: You decide to leave the filthy hay where it is

object.name: Sharp Axe
object.look: An axe with an arms length wooden haft and a sharpened steel head with the letter L and the pattern of a rose embossed on it. It is your prized (and only) possession given to you by your father. It's blade is sharp as frost.
object.dropmsg: You drop the useful looking axe, a wise move I'm sure

selfuseon.item: msg ("You swing your trusty axe and reduce the tree to four body-length logs") MakeObjectInvisible (fallen tree) MakeObjectVisible (Logs)

object.name: Northern Woods
object.description: You are on a path in the woods that runs North to South, the trees are densely packed, shards of sunlight stab through the small gaps in the canopy, it is humid in here. The floor of the forest is thick with leaf litter from countless autumns.

object.name: Twisted Oak
object.look:
An enormous oak tree lies to the side of the path. Its trunk and branches are twisted into contorted and tortured shapes like writhing serpents.

Nestled into the base of the tree is a small blue door.

object.name: Handwritten Sign
object.look:
In perfect copperplate the sign reads,

'Residence of Gnome Chompsky, Master Weaver and Tailor, No Free Papers, Thank You'
object.takemsg: it's not yours

object.name: Small Blue Door
object.look: A small arched shaped door around 2 foot high and painted a pale pastel blue colour. There is a handwritten sign next to it.

object.name: Wood Gnome Chompsky
object.look:
He's just over a foot tall, including his bright red brimless conical cap. He's wearing a pastel blue jacket with a belt fastened at the middle, black trousers and comically big (relative to his stature) black boots.

He has a white beard and a mischievous twinkle in his eyes.
object.speak: "I'm always willing to help a traveller in these woods, what can I do for you?"

ask.item:
msg ("
\"Yes I've seen it, must have been some heavy rainfall in the hills. Don't try swimming across, the current is far too strong and the water is deathly cold. Don't hold your breath for the council to fix the bridge anytime soon, all the infrastructure taxes get spent in Lost.\"")

msg ("
\"My stock and trade, I learnt my craft at the University of Somewhere. I can weave just about anything if the materials are half decent.\"")

object.name: leaf litter
object.look: The floor of the woods is carpeted in a deep layer of dead leaves, ranging in colour from a deep copper to pale yellow
object.takemsg: you decide to leave the leaves where they are

object.name: Rope
object.look: A strong coil of rope weaved from reeds

selfuseon.item: msg ("You lash the logs together with the rope, you now have what could very generously be described as a raft. Dylan eyes it suspiciously. ") RemoveObject (Logs) RemoveObject (Rope) AddToInventory (Raft)

object.name: Raft
object.look: Your 'artisan' raft, made from four body length logs lashed together with rope

object.name: Drunk Miller
object.shoutat: You shout at the top of your voice, but Wendy doesn't stir. Dylan whimpers and nuzzles your leg for reassurance.
object.look: A stern looking dark haired lady, she is wearing a pale blue shin length smock, a red neckerchief, and a brown Quaker style hat. She is currently sound asleep and snoring at an unbelievable volume. A fog of cider fumes is in the air around her.
object.screamat: You scream at the top of your lungs, but Wendy doesn't stir. Dylan whimpers and nuzzles your leg for reassurance.
object.shake: You gently shake the Miller but she doesn't stir
object.push: You give the Miller a gentle push but she doesn't stir
object.pull: You give the Miller a gentle pull but she doesn't stir
object.slap: You consider slapping the Miller around the face, but it doesn't seem right

object.name: Awake Miller
object.look: A stern looking dark haired lady, she is wearing a pale blue shin length smock, a red neckerchief, and a brown Quaker style hat that is dripping water on to the floor.

ask.item:
msg ("
\"Fabulous contraption isn't it? There's rumours from Lost of a new technology coming to replace 'em, something to do with fire and steam, sounds hideous.\"")

msg ("
\"Yes it's a bit of weakness of mine, but well, you can't be good all the time can you?\"")

msg ("
\"That damn creature, clip-clippety-clopping all over the place, does me head in!\"")

msg ("
\"Only two things in life are certain: death and axes. The former usually follows the latter.\"")

msg ("
Wendy blushes slightly,
\"Yes he's a good friend of mine, he was here last night, we had a fair few pints of cider, I hope he doesn't feel as rough as me today\"")

msg ("
\"ooh, now that is a shame, nothing ever seems to get fixed anymore, whatever happened to civic pride eh?\"")

msg ("
\"well he's a fair ruler, not exactly mister dynamic, but he's kept the peace all these years\"")

object.name: Stairs
Mouse
object.look: A tiny grey-furred mouse, who looks to all the world as if it's wearing tiny little clogs, it's making a 'clip-clippety clop' noise as it scurries up and down the stairs.

object.name: Sandy Beach
object.description:
You are on long, bleak, sandy beach on the shore of the Sea of Emptiness. There is a brisk and bracing (i.e. bloody freezing) sea-breeze.

Dylan bounds around in circles in the sand wagging his tail.

command.name: k25
command.script: msg ("No chance. Even if you had the strength to get past the breakers, you would surely freeze to death.")

object.name: Bottle
object.look: A blue glass bottle with the word "FLY" embossed on it.
object.takemsg: You pick it up.

object.name: Scroll
object.dropmsg: You drop the useful looking axe, a wise move I'm sure
object.look:
You unfurl the scroll of paper it reads,


"Help! We're under siege, the Bony King has been imprisoned in his Castle. General D'sarray and the armed forces have assumed control"

You let out an audible groan and say to yourself. 'let me get this straight, if I don't deliver the letter then the King will have me killed, if on the otherhand I do try to deliver it then the General will have me killed.'

You turn the scroll over and on the reverse side there is a printed score of music, titled "Adagio in G Minor, by Albinoni", you vaguely remember the piece from the piano lessons your father gave you, back in more comfortable times.
object.read:
You unfurl the scroll of paper it reads,

"Help! We're under siege, the Bony King has been imprisoned in his Castle. General D'sarray and the armed forces have assumed control"

You let out an audible groan and say to yourself. 'let me get this straight, if I don't deliver the letter then the King will have me killed, if on the otherhand I do try to deliver it then the General will have me killed.'

You turn the scroll over and on the reverse side there is a printed score of music, titled "Adagio in G Minor, by Albinoni", you vaguely remember the piece from the piano lessons your father gave you, back in more comfortable times.

selfuseon.item: msg ("You swing your axe at the fallen tree, but is too blunt to chop it. ")

object.name: Empty Sea
object.look: The sea stretches as far as the horizon. A powerful surf is roaring and rolling before pounding into the shore, then receding for a few seconds and crashing in again.

object.name: sand
object.look: Soft sand, gives a cheerful tone to a desolate place, sandguine you could say.

object.name: Pub
object.description:
You are inside a proper old boozer. You are luckily enough to live before the smoking ban so there is no stench of urinals and stale beer, just lovely stale smoke.

There is a new-fangled invention called carpet on the floor, it is sticky underfoot. There are wooden benches and stools. The Barman is behind the bar polishing glasses with a face as long as a wet weekend in Coventry.

turnscript.name: piano appear

command.name: k26

object.name: Pool Table
object.look: A traditional pub pool table, 7 x 4 foot. The green baize is in decent enough condition, and with only a few drink stains
object.play:
msg ("You pick up the pool cue and look down its shaft, it's straight as a die. You check the tip and it is secure and properly rounded.

You grab the chalk and carefully stoke the tip with it and blow off the excess.

You spend a minute setting up the balls correctly, then taking careful aim you hit the cue ball, your cue rips into the baize, and the cue ball shoots into the air and smashes the glass that the Landlord is holding.

With a face like thunder the Landlord walks over to the pool table, firmly takes the cue from you and places a sign on the table reading \"Out of Order\".") MakeObjectInvisible (Pool Table) MakeObjectVisible (Broken Pool Table) IncreaseObjectCounter (Pub, "fun")

object.name: Out of tune Piano
object.look: A beautiful old upright Feurich piano in burnish walnut
object.play:
msg ("You used to play a little when you were younger, you sit down and start to plonk your way through Maple Leaf Rag, but the piano is horribly out of tune. The Landlord eyes you with a world weary expression.

Suddenly Gerald the Mouse appears.") MoveObjectHere (Piano Tuner Mouse)

object.name: One Armed Bandit
object.look:
On the end of the bar is a One Armed Bandit machine, it's metal and looks like it weighs a tonne. There is a lever sticking out of the side of it, on the front is a glass window looking into three reels with symbols on.

Written on the front it says "Skulls and Axes" match three symbols to win!

object.name: Out of Order One Armed Bandit
object.look:
On the end of the bar is a One Armed Bandit machine, it's metal and looks like it weighs a tonne. There is a lever sticking out of the side of it, on the front is a glass window looking into three reels with symbols on.

Written on the front it says "Skulls and Axes" match three symbols to win!

Unfortunately it is locked up and an "Out of Order" signs hangs from it.
object.unlock: You place your hand on it and the Landlord immediately shouts across, "HEY! Leave that damn thing alone!"
object.smash: You go to grab the machine and the Landlord immediately shouts across, "HEY! Leave that damn thing alone!"

object.name: Jack The Landlord
object.look: 'Merry' by name but not by nature it seems. As you look at him, he stares back and lets out an exacerbated sigh of such length you wonder if he has sprung a leak.

object.name: Dartboard
object.look: A cork and wire dartboard, 17 34 inches in diameter and divided into 20 radial sections.

object.name: Out of Order Dartboard
object.look: A cork and wire dartboard, 17 34 inches in diameter and divided into 20 radial sections. Hanging on the dartboard is a sign reading "Do not touch!"
object.play: The landlord has confiscated the darts, probably best to leave it

object.name: Tuned Piano
object.look: A beautiful old upright Feurich piano in burnish walnut, now perfectly in tune

object.name: Pub Gnome
object.look:
He's just over a foot tall, including his bright red brimless conical cap. He's wearing a pastel blue jacket with a belt fastened at the middle, black trousers and comically big (relative to his stature) black boots.

He has a white beard and a mischievous twinkle in his eyes, he drinking a pint of dark porter

object.name: Three Coins
object.look: Three silver 1 zilch coins, the currency of Nowhere. They have a portrait of the skeletal 'Bony' King on the obverse and an Axe on the other side. Inscribed around the edge it reads, "Quidquid latinae dictum set, altrum sonar "

giveto.item:
msg ("
\"Grazie mille!\" says Beppe,

He scoops a huge pizza out of the oven with his peal, places it in a cardboard tray, closes the lid and hands it to you.") AddToInventory (Huge Pizza) MakeObjectInvisible (Three Coins)

object.name: Sack of Wheat
object.look: A small hessian bag of wheat
object.eat: You nibble a few grains of wheat, but they are too tough to eat

giveto.item:
msg ("\"I can mill this for you no problem, about time I got to work anyway, hang on.\"

The miller walks over to the wall and pulls a hidden lever, after a few seconds the grindstone begins to move, and you can hear the sails and gears making a pleasing repetitive , \"Koor-keeer, chick-a-clunk..\" noise as they spin round.

Wendy empties the wheat into the hopper, and in a few seconds has filled a small sack with flour which she hands to you.") RemoveObject (Sack of Wheat) AddToInventory (Sack of Flour) SetObjectFlagOn (Awake Miller, "working_miller")

object.name: Sack of Flour
object.look: A brown hessian sack of flour, the label on the bag reads, "Product of Coley's Mill, the taste of Yeasterday"

giveto.item: msg ("\"Ah, excellent, thank you! In return I've finished fixing your fishing rod, here\" and he hands it to you.") RemoveObject (Sack of Flour) AddToInventory (Fixed Fishing Rod)

object.name: Fixed Fishing Rod
object.look: A bamboo fishing rod, with a cork handle. It has a line and hook, and a now fully functional reel.

object.name: Southern Woodland Dell
object.description:
A small secluded grassy hollow, there is thick lush grass under foot.

You can see a Horse drawn caravan, and a Horse unhitched from it.

Sat on the caravan steps is a bearded man in ragged clothing, using your legendary powers of deduction (by reading the writing on the side of the caravan) you deduce that he is a travelling Tinker.

object.name: Horse Drawn Caravan
object.look: A horseshose shaped cylindrical wooden caravan. It's body is pale green and the ribbing is painted red. It has large yellow cartwheels shod with metal. On the side is a lettering reading "All smithing and repair work undertaken, enquire with driver"

object.name: Tinker
object.look: A friendly looking wiry built chap in his mid-fifties, he has a wiry black beard, a battered derby hat, he's smoking a clay pipe and playing with a backgammon set.

ask.item:
msg ("
\"She's a beauty ain't she? Runs like the wind when she has the mind to, my late wife named her Dobby\"")

msg ("
\"A pleasant way to pass the time, the concentration calms my mind, more skill in the game than most folks think\"")

msg ("
\"Hand-built by my Grandfather, back when the Bony King was a child, and the world was a gentler place\" ")

object.name: Horse
object.look: A beautiful Irish Cob horse, standing 14 hands tall and piebald with white patches scattered over its black body. It has a silky long black and white mane, and white feathering hair on its lower legs. It looks at you, snorts gently and nods its head.
object.stroke: You stroke the horse, its hair is silky and warm, you can feel the contours of its muscles, it nickers and nuzzles against your hand. "He's a beauty, isn't he", says the Tinker, "He seems to like you!"

object.name: Backgammon
object.look: A beautiful wooden backgammon set, consisting of a wooden board, two sets of 15 checkers, two pairs of dice, a doubling cube, and dice cups.
object.takemsg: It's not yours

object.name: Dull Glass Sphere
object.look: A fist sized glass sphere, it is perfectly smooth and round, but has a smeared and dirty surface.

object.name: Loft
Set Mousetrap
object.takemsg: You decide to leave the mousetrap where it is
object.look: msg ("A wooden spring loaded mouse trap, with a piece of cheese as bait. You consider these traps rather cruel, so you decide to caerphilly unset the trap and place the piece of cheese in your pocket.") AddToInventory (Lump of Cheese) MakeObjectVisible (unset mousetrap) MakeObjectInvisible (Set Mousetrap)

object.name: unset mousetrap
object.look: A wooden spring loaded mousetrap, that you have unset.
object.takemsg: You decide to leave the mouse trap where it is
object.set: You consider these traps to be cruel so you don't set it

object.name: Gears
Shaft
Lump of Cheese
object.look: A small piece of cheese that you stole from a mousetrap, it's not your cheese, in fact it's Nacho Cheese.

giveto.item:
MakeObjectInvisible (Cavern Mouse) msg ("You break a small piece off the lump of cheese and give it to the mouse. The mouse reaches up with it's little front paws, grabs the cheese, gobbles it down, then gives a tiny squeak of appreciation.

It then draws its tiny sword, dashes fearlessly over to the Cat and stabs it in the nose with his tiny sword. The Cat is stunned for a moment and then erupts in screeching anger, swiping at the mouse, Gerald parries expertly with his shield and dashes away, the Cat shoots off in chase.") UnlockExit (guarded entrance) MakeObjectInvisible (Cat)

MakeObjectInvisible (Out of tune Piano) MakeObjectVisible (Tuned Piano) msg ("You break a small piece off the lump of cheese and give it to the mouse. The mouse reaches up with it's little front paws, grabs the cheese, gobbles it down, then gives a tiny squeak of appreciation.

Gerald opens the lid of the piano and jumps inside, there a commotion of plinking, plonking and squeaking. Then Gerald reappears, jumps on to the keyboard and plays a sweet rendition of \"Old Amsterdam\" by running around and stamping on the keys with his feet.

The Landlord gives a small slow sarcastic round of applause. The Mouse takes a bow, gives the Landlord the finger and dashes off.") MakeObjectInvisible (Piano Tuner Mouse)

msg ("You break a small piece off the lump of cheese and give it to the mouse. The mouse reaches up with it's little front paws, grabs the cheese, removes his tiny respirator from his mouth, gobbles it down, then gives a tiny squeak of appreciation.

Replacing his respirator Gerald performs a perfect back flip into the pool and disappears beneath its surface. After a few moments you notice a loud gurgling sound a a whirpool forming on the surface of the pool, the water level is going down.

As the last of the water disappears down a large hole in the floor of the pool you see Gerald brandishing what appears to be an oversized bathroom plug on a chain. Gerald waves at you and disappears down the hole.
") MakeObjectInvisible (Scuba Mouse) MakeExitVisible (plug) SetObjectFlagOn (Well of Desolation, "drained") MakeObjectVisible (Plughole) MakeObjectVisible (Giants Hair) MakeObjectInvisible (pool)

msg ("You break a small piece off the lump of cheese and give it to the mouse. The mouse reaches up with it's little front paws which are wearing adorable tiny gauntlets, takes the cheese, raises his visor and gobbles it down, and then gives a tiny squeak of appreciation, and with a salute closes his visor.

Aiming his lance at the General on the other side of the square, Gerald runs at full charge.

Just as Gerald reaches the General he is spotted, the General takes a swing with his foot and with sickening force kicks Gerald so hard that he goes flying into the air and over the castle walls.

Dylan wimpers, tears well in your eyes and a violent rage burns in your heart.

\"Rodent scum,\" grunts the General.

") SetObjectFlagOn (Knight Mouse, "mouse_dead") MakeObjectInvisible (Knight Mouse)

object.name: Outside The Forsaken Cavern

exit.name: guarded entrance
exit.lockmessage: You step towards the entrance to the cave, Dylan whimpers but loyally follows at your side, the cat hisses at you, you take another step forward and the cat swipes at your feet, scratching you painfully with its razor sharp claws, you jump back and decide against trying that again!

object.name: Cat
object.look: A mean looking Bengal Cat, light brown and spotted like a leopard. It flashes its needle like teeth at you, and then looks at Dylan and scrunches up its nose in distain.
object.stroke: You nervously approach the Cat, and reach out your hand. The Cat hisses violently at you and glancing at its teeth and claws you decide better of it.

object.name: Inside The Forsaken Cavern
object.description:
You are inside a large cavern carved out of limestone, the light from your sphere casts strange shadows from the long stalactites fingers that must have taken centuries to form.

Above you hangs a huge Bat, below it there is a large pile of droppings.

You can make out an exit to the South, and the exit Out.

object.name: Bat
object.look: An enormous fruit bat hangs from the roof of the cave. It is at least a metre in length with folded leathery wings that must span twice that. It has huge bulbous black eyes that stare back at you. For some inexplicable reason it is wearing rubber suit and cape, the hood has pointy ears and there is a bat symbol on its chest.

object.name: Guano unsolved
object.takemsg: You attempt to grab some of the guano, but quick as a flash the Bat throws something at your head, it smacks you with violent force and then returns to the Bat's claw like a boomerang. "I am the Night!" mumbles the Bat in a low voice.
object.look: A large pile of slightly steaming, thin sausage shaped, black bat droppings.

object.name: Guano solved
object.look: A large pile of thin sausage shaped black bat droppings

object.name: Business Card
object.look:
A tiny business card, made of exquisite silken paper. In a minute gothic script it reads,

_______________________________________________________________________



'Gerald T. Mouse, freelance adventurer, no quest too great or small.'

'Payment in cheese only!'



________________________________________________________________

object.name: Golden Fish
object.look: A large golden fish, its iridescent scales sparkle in the light

giveto.item: msg ("Dylan sniffs the fish, and looks at you with a puzzled expression")

object.name: Silver Fish
object.look: A large silver coloured fish, its iridescent scales sparkle in the light

giveto.item: msg ("Dylan sniffs the fish, and looks at you with a puzzled expression")

object.name: Copper Fish
object.look: A large copper coloured fish, its iridescent scales sparkle in the light

giveto.item: msg ("Dylan sniffs the fish, and looks at you with a puzzled expression")

object.name: Cavern Mouse
object.look: Gerald is wearing a red musketeer costume, with a black belt and black boots, he is wielding a tiny beveled metal shield with a fleur-de-lis design and has a tiny sword at his side. He is also wearing a musketeer hat, with purple ribbon, a silver buckle and a white feather sticking up at the back. He cuts a fine dash!

object.name: Shiny Glass Sphere
object.look: A fist sized glass sphere, it is perfectly smooth and round, it has a highly polished surface. It reflects a curved and inverted image of the landscape.

object.name: Torch
Stone Stairs
object.descprefix: You are at the top of the
object.description: You are stood at the top of a huge spiral stone staircase carved out of the rock, somewhere below you can hear the sound of dripping water.
object.darkroomdescription: It is pitch black here, you attempt to move but trip on a step, it's too dangerous without light.

object.name: Well of Desolation
object.darkroomdescription: It is pitch black here, all you can make out is the dripping of water.

command.name: k45
command.script:
msg ("
You dip an exploratory toe into the water, it is so cold it numbs your entire foot, you decide against getting further in.")

object.name: Plughole
object.look: A plug shaped hole, pitch black inside, there appear to be a few long strands of hair attached to it.

object.name: Giants Hair
object.look: A few fine strands of very long grey hair, tough as rope.

giveto.item:
msg ("\"Well, well, well, what do we have here! Giant's hair, rare stuff this, makes the best rope known to man, let's see what we can do\"

With astonishing speed and dexterity the Gnome twists and plaits and weaves the strands of hair together into a long, thin, but incredibly strong rope, he hands it to you.
") AddToInventory (giant rope) RemoveObject (Giants Hair)

object.name: pool
object.swim: You dip an exploratory toe into the water, it is so cold it numbs your foot, you decide against getting further in.
object.dive: You dip an exploratory toe into the water, it is so cold it numbs your entire foot, you decide against getting further in.
object.wade: You dip an exploratory toe into the water, it is so cold it numbs your entire foot, you decide against getting further in.
object.wadeinto: You dip an exploratory toe into the water, it is so cold it numbs your entire foot, you decide against getting further in.
object.swimacross: You dip an exploratory toe into the water, it is so cold it numbs your entire foot, you decide against getting further in.
object.diveinto: You dip an exploratory toe into the water, it is so cold it numbs your entire foot, you decide against getting further in.
object.look: A huge underground pool, there is a steady drip of water from the stalactites above. The water looks extremely cold and deep. Your breath mists in the air.

object.name: Piano Tuner Mouse
object.look: It's Gerald the Mouse, he's wearing a smart grey suit and half-moon spectacles, and he's carrying a small metal lever.

object.name: Scuba Mouse
object.look: It's Gerald the Mouse, this time he is wearing a full scuba suit, complete with flippers, mask, and a respirator connected by tiny rubber hoses to two bright yellow oxygen tanks on his back. He gives you a thumps-up sign.

object.name: Chipped Mug With Guano
object.look: An old brown clay mug, chipped on the rim. On the side it reads 'Mug puns are tea-dious'. It is full of sightly steaming Bat Guano

selfuseon.item: RemoveObject (Chipped Mug With Guano) AddToInventory (Mug) MakeObjectInvisible (Horehound sick) MakeObjectVisible (Horehound Well) msg ("You pour the Bat Guano on to the clump of horehound, just at that moment there is a convenient brief shower of rain. The leaves of the horehound plump up and unfurl before your eyes.")

object.name: Top of the Stone Slide
object.darkroomdescription: It is pitch-back here, you the floor feels damp and slimy underfoot.
object.description: You are at the top of a U-shaped spiral slide carved out of the stone, presumably used to drain the water from the floor above. The surface is slimy and slippery underfoot

command.name: k48
command.script:
msg ("Grabbing hold of Dylan you launch yourself down the spiral slide. building up speed at an alarming rate.

You cling on to Dylan and together you career down the slide until you see an oval of daylight getting larger, you are spat out at high velocity into the daylight, luckily the ground is soft and boggy and you land without injury, blinking in the daylight. Dylan licks your face.") MoveObject (player, Midland Marshes)

exit.name: exit31
exit.script:
msg ("You start to gingerly descend down the slippery spiral slope, but as you turn a corner you loose your footing and behind slipping and sliding down, building up speed at an alarming rate.

Dylan come bounding after you, looses his balance and careers into your back. You cling on to Dylan and together you speed down the slide until you see an oval of daylight getting larger, you are spat out at high velocity into the daylight, luckily the ground is soft and boggy and you land without injury, blinking in the daylight. Dylan licks your face.") MoveObject (player, Midland Marshes)

object.name: Midland Marshes
object.description:
A bleak wetland with long grasses, and low growing shrubs and bracken. Far on the horizon you can just make out the silhouette of the the City of Lost.

To the southeast you can see a Brewery, with steam and smoke rising from several chimneys on the roof, there is the smell of yeast and hops in the air.

exit.name: exit32
exit.lockmessage: It is too steep and slippery to go up this way

object.name: City of Lost
object.look: The silhouette of the City of Lost is on the horizon, its been many years since you saw it. It invokes both dread and painful nostalgia. Amongst the building shapes you can make out the crenelations of the King's Castle walls and keep.

object.name: Brewery
object.description: The room is dominated by huge towering metal tanks, connected by a complicated system of pipes and valves. You can make out what you assume is a Mash Tun (you can see workmen up at the top pouring grain and water into it) which in turn is connected to a huge Brewing Kettle and a Fermentation Tank.

object.name: Brewing Kettle
object.look: A huge metal cylinder tank, connected by pipework to the Mash Tun and the Fermentation Tank

object.name: Fermentation Tank
object.look: A huge metal cylinder, attached by pipework to the Brewing Kettle

object.name: Mash Tun
object.look: A huge metal cylinder, at the top you can see workmen pouring grain and water into it. It is connected by pipes to the Brewing Kettle.

object.name: Pint Glass
workmen
object.look: A couple of stout workmen are topping up the mash tun, ale in a day's work for them

object.name: Brewery Yard
Hungover Cooper
object.look: The Cooper is wearing blue denim dungarees, a plaid red and black shirt and a flat cap. His skin is palid pale and green around the gills, he is sweating profusely, groaning and holding his brow. He's not doing any work.
object.speak: "My poor head! That damn Miller and her cider, horrible gut rotting stuff, I should have stuck with the Banks's, I can't see or think straight to work, the Gaffer is going to fire me if I can't shift this hangover." The thought of the drink brings another wave of nausea over the poor chap and he sways on his stool.

object.name: Cured Cooper
object.look: The Cooper is wearing blue denim dungarees, a plaid red and black shirt and a flat cap. He's hard at work making barrels.

object.name: half made barrels
object.look: A stack of barrels in various stages of completion, but none of them are finished
object.fix: you don't have the materials or the skills
object.make: you don't have the materials or the skills
object.takemsg: you don't need them

object.name: made barrels
object.look: Barrels, barrels everywhere; some standing in the yard waiting to be shipped out, others being carried out of the brewery by the workers. The Cooper is hard a work keeping a fresh supply coming
object.takemsg: you don't need them

object.name: stool
object.look: A three-legged joined wooden stool, The Cooper is sat on it
object.takemsg: The Cooper is using it to sit on

object.name: workers
hair of dog
object.look: A few strands of Dylan's brown and white hair

object.name: Brewery Canteen
object.description: It's the staff kitchen, industrial, stainless steel everywhere and clean as a whistle.

object.name: Celery
object.look: A long fibrous green stalk tapering into yellow leaves

object.name: Ice
object.look: It's ice, ice baby!

object.name: Toms
tomato juice
object.look: Bright red tomato juice, it has a tangy sweet smell

object.name: Can Opener
object.look: A metal butterfly can opener

object.name: Outside City Gates
object.description: You are outside the city walls of Lost. There is a City Guard in front of you, and behind him a set of huge wrought-iron gates.

exit.name: gates
exit.lockmessage: "Halt!" barks the Guard, "I'm under strict orders not to allow any northerners into the city"

object.name: City Guard
object.look:
One of the General's goons, with a jobsworth moronic grin on his face, as with most of these types if he ever had a brain cell it died of loneliness a long long time ago.

His CV no doubt lists following orders and stabbing things with the pointy end of his sword as his favourite hobbies.
object.speak: "Move away peasant, leave good, remain bad"

object.name: gate
object.look: A huge wrought iron gate, you can see the city plaza through the bars. It is at least 12 feet high, so there's no chance of climbing over it. The iron bars have been expertly bent into the shape of a spiders web.

object.name: City Plaza
object.description:
Large open public space, and the heart of the city. Doesn't seem to be many people around though, perhaps they are hiding from the army.

On the south side of the square there is a row of soldiers on horseback, blocking the path to the castle drawbridge.

In the centre of the square there is a fountain, underneath which you can see an emaciated pigeon pecking at a few biscuit crumbs.

object.name: Sick Pigeon Jon
object.look: A skinny grey city pigeon with a grumpy demeanour
object.askdefault:
msg ("
\"fucked if I know anything about that\"")

ask.item:
msg ("
\"He's banged up in the prison, he refused to invade the Kingdom of Somewhere, made the General furious, that hawk hasn't had a decent war in decades and finally snapped.\" Once again the pigeon starts coughing in an alarming fashion.")

msg ("
\"They're my biscuit crumbs, fuck you. I'm bloody starving, no people means no litter means hungry Jon\" *hack, hack, cough*")

msg ("
\"That Warmongering fucknugget! Tried to convince the King that Somewhere are developing Weapons of Mass Destruction, the King was having none of it without evidence\" *cough, cough, hack*")

msg ("
\"A kindly lass, she sometime feeds me biscuits, but boy is she a fiend for the cider!\" *cough, cough, splutter*")

msg ("
\"Oh you've met that nutter then? Fruitbat? Fruitcake more like! Ha ha ha!\" *cough, hack, cough*")

msg ("
\"Oh you noticed did you? Driving me nuts, still you know what they say, 'It's not the cough that carries you off, it's the coffin they carry you off in! Ha Ha Ha!\" *Cough, cough, hack*")

object.name: Biscuit crumbs
object.look: A few tiny crumbs of biscuit
object.takemsg: You stoop down to pick it up but the pigeon exclaims, "These are my biscuit crumbs, fuck off, *hack hack, cough*". The murderous glint in the pigeon's eye persuades you to leave the crumbs on the ground.

object.name: Fountain
object.look:
The tall fountain consists of a tower of stacked marble skulls, decending in size to the top. Water pours from the eye sockets of one skull into a hole in the cranium of the one below.

The city planners really took the King's nickname to heart, although a sense of the morbid has always characterised this country well before his reign.

object.name: Well Pigeon Jon
object.look: A grey city pigeon with a grumpy demeanour, and splattered with pieces of cheese and tomato sauce

ask.item:
msg ("
\"He's banged up in the prison, he refused to invade the Kingdom of Somewhere, made the General furious, that hawk hasn't had a decent war in decades and finally snapped.\" ")
msg ("\"They're my biscuit crumbs, fuck you.\"")

msg ("
\"That Warmongering fucknugget! Tried to convince the King that Somewhere are developing Weapons of Mass Destruction, the King was having none of it without evidence\" ")

msg ("
\"A kindly lass, she sometime feeds me biscuits, but boy is she a fiend for the cider!\"")

msg ("
\"Oh you've met that nutter then? Fruitbat? Fruitcake more like! Ha ha ha!\" *cough, hack, cough*")

object.name: General
object.look: An ugly bloated porcine looking army general. His drab olive uniform is festooned with medals and gold braiding, he has a swagger stick under one arm and is wearing black jackboots, and a black hat with a red front and more gold braiding.
object.speak: Move along citizen, or I'll have you thrown in irons

object.name: Pizzaria
object.description: There is a heavenly smell of dough, cheese and woodsmoke in here. Behind the counter you can see the owner Beppe removing pizzas from the oven with a long peal.

object.name: Beppe
object.look: A dark and swarthy type with a roman nose and a friendly grin. He's wearing chef whites and a white cap.

object.name: Counter
object.look:
A wooden counter with a hammered zinc top, there is a sign reading,

'Beppe's stupendo pizza

Piccolo - 1 Zilch

Medio - 2 Zilch

Gigantesco! - 3 Zilch'

object.name: Prison
object.description: A dark and dank prison cell, with filthy straw on the hard stone floor, the walls of the cell is in the form of an iron cage.

object.name: pile of stones
object.look: The stones you removed to make the hole, what a waste of time that was.
object.takemsg: you don't need them

object.name: lower straw
object.move: moving the straw reveals an impressively well built and impenetrable stone floor
object.look: Blackened filthy straw, it stinks and is sticky to the touch
object.takemsg: Moving aside the straw reveals an immaculate and impenetrable stone floor

object.name: floor1
object.look: You examine the floor, moving aside the straw reveals an immaculate and impenetrable stone floor

object.name: bars
object.look: Thick iron bars, it would take a month of Sundays to file your way though one of them, even if you had the tools

object.name: Huge Pizza
object.openmsg: You decide to leave it shut to keep the pizza hot.
object.look: A huge cardboard pizza box with a picture of Venice on the front, steam is escaping from the lovely pizza inside, it smells heavenly.
object.eat: You'd love to eat it, but perhaps someone else needs it more

giveto.item:
SetObjectFlagOn (Sick Pigeon Jon, "fed") msg ("
\"Fuck me, now you're talking\" says the pigeon...*hack* *splutter*, \"I haven't eaten properly in weeks\"

The pigeon dives into the pizza, there is a blur of wings, feathers, feet and beak, small pieces of cheese and dough fly into the air. After a few minutes the pizza is gone and a fatter looking pigeon is now standing there.") RemoveObject (Huge Pizza)

SetObjectFlagOn (Well Pigeon Jon, "fed") msg ("
\"Fuck me, now you're talking\" says the pigeon... \"I haven't eaten properly in weeks\"

The pigeon dives into the pizza, there is a blur of wings, feathers, feet and beak, small pieces of cheese and dough fly into the air. After a few minutes the pizza is gone and a fatter looking pigeon is now standing there.") RemoveObject (Huge Pizza)

object.name: Withered Heath
object.description: A god-forsaken stretch of land on the side of the cavern hill. There is some horehound growing here

command.name: k49
command.pattern: ^put guano on horehound$|^pour guano on horehound$|^pour guano on ground$|^put guano on ground$|^empty mug on horehound$|^empty mug on ground$

object.name: Horehound sick
object.look: A clump of withered horehound, a herb of the mint family, you've often used it yourself to ease a cough, but this clump is no good, the leaves are all shrivelled up.
object.takemsg: There is no point in taking any of it, it's sick and withered

object.name: Horehound Well
object.look: A healthy specimen of horehound with plump leaves and white flowers, a herb of the mint family, you've often used it yourself to ease a cough.

giveto.item:
msg ("\"What this herbal shite when it's at home?\" Says Jon, \"Only joking, horehound weed aint' it. The Pigeon pecks a small corner of leaf, \"well it tastes like crap but I'll try anything to shift this damn cough\"

The pigeon pecks and chews at the leaves for a few minutes, and his breathing seems to ease, \"Thanks\" he says, \"Don't take my swearing personally, you're a decent fucker\"") MakeObjectInvisible (Sick Pigeon Jon) MakeObjectVisible (Well Pigeon Jon) RemoveObject (Horehound Well)

object.name: message
object.look:
A tiny scroll of paper, in minute writing it reads:

"Attack at dawn, resistance ready, J.J"

object.name: Knight Mouse
object.look: It's Gerald the Mouse, this time he is wearing a full suit of armour, including helmet with the visor down. He is holding a lance in one hand and a shield in the other.

object.name: Courtyard
object.description:
msg ("
You are lead into the Castle courtyard, the pale blue light in the East heralds that the arrival of dawn is nigh. You, the King and Dylan are led to platform and each tied to stake. You can't believe they are going to kill Dylan as well.

\"I'm so sorry\" says the King, \"I know you never wanted any part in the politics of the Kingdom, I'm sorry I brought you back here, I didn't know who else to send the letter to\"

\"That's OK Dad\", you reply.

The first rays of dawn hit the courtyard and make you blink in the light.

Facing you is a firing squad and General D'sarray, \"Silence traitors!\" barks the General.

\"Men on my mark take aim!\", \"Aim\", the squad raise their guns, \"Ready\", you brace yourself, at that moment the sky darkens, confused the General looks up, and is hit smack in the temple by what looks like a metal boomerang, he collapses to the floor like a sack of spuds. More boomerangs rain down on the firing squad.

Looking up you see it's Batbat! and who's is that riding on his back but Gerald! He's wearing some weird rubber suit with a red letter R on the front.

There is a thundering of hooves and the Loyal forces storm into the courtyard, rounding up the remaining soldiers.

\"You saved the Kingdom my child!\" says the King, \"You're welcome to it\" you reply, \"I'm off home to the North\", \"Come on Dylan, let's go!\", \"Thank fuck for that\" replies Dylan.

**************************************************************************
Congratulations, you have completed The Bony King of Nowhere, thanks for playing!

The END

Credits:

Written and coded by Luke A. Jones (luke.jones@gmail.com), using the Quest text adventure engine (www.textadeventures.co.uk).

Thank you to Alex Dimmer for creating the artwork and to Jennifer Thompson and Joe Dillon for alpa and beta testing, and for their excellent suggestions for improvements.

Thanks also to the excellent support from the Quest forum members, a more friendly bunch of geeks you won't meet.

I was inspired to start writing text adventures after playing and testing the wonderful games by Robin Johnson, you should check them out: http://versificator.net/

The title of the game comes from a song in an episode of Bagpuss by Oliver Postgate

The pigeon was inspired by the twitter account @pigeonjohn

Be excellent to each other.

Luke") finish

object.name: Top Prison
object.beforeenter: ChangePOV (empty player) MoveObject (empty player, Top Prison) MakeObjectInvisible (player)

object.name: Bony King
object.look: The 'bony' king of Nowhere, stick thin, (you'd find more meat on a butchers pencil), his emaciated face is even more drawn than the last time you saw him. His regal red robes hang off him, he's sat uncomfortably on the straw.
object.speak: "Hello my child, its a joy to see you, even under such grim circumstances"

ask.item:
msg ("
'I told the pigeon to drop it outside your home, there was never anything written inside it, was too risky\"")

msg ("
\"Ah Jack, as loyal as is face is long, he's been keeping in touch with the troops still loyal to the crown\"")

msg ("
\"I miss her too, you must get your love of the countryside from here, she was never truly happy in the city either\"")

msg ("
\"He's always been a hawk for conflict, but never thought he'd betray me, barks all the time, but he finally bit.\" \"His men only fear and don't love him though, his power base is weak.\"")

msg ("
\"Ha, the wisest of Nowhere's citizens, not much gets past him, loyal as long as he's well fed\"")

exit.name: tunnel
exit.script:
msg ("With a great deal of struggling, writhing and wriggling you manage to squeeze through the hole, your Father and Dylan have far less trouble and follow behind you.

You land on some filthy straw") MoveObject (empty player, Prison) MoveObject (Bony King, Prison)

object.name: floor
loose stone
object.takemsg: You grab hold of the loose stone, with a great deal of wiggling you manage to remove it, after a lot of hard work you manage to remove a few more until eventually there is a hole barely big enough to fit through

object.name: top straw
object.look: Blackened filthy straw, it stinks and is sticky to the touch
object.takemsg: moving aside the filthy straw reveals the stoney floor, but wait, one of the stones is loose!
object.move: msg ("Moving aside the filthy straw reveals the stoney floor, but wait one of the stones is loose!") MakeObjectVisible (loose stone)

object.name: bars1
object.look: Thick iron bars, it would take a month of Sundays to file your way though one of them, even if you had the tools

giveto.item:
msg ("The Cooper steadies himself and with shaking hands his grips the glass and takes a sip of the drink, he grimaces and spits it out,

\"That's not going to help me! I need something stronger than that!\"")

object.name: empty player
object.look: You are thin and your skin is grimy, you are wearing ragged grey woollen clothing

giveto.item:
msg ("The Cooper steadies himself and with shaking hands his grips the glass and takes a sip of the drink, he grimaces then drains the lot,
\"Ah, hair of the dog, always does the trick!\" \" Many thanks to you, here take this..\" He hands you a growler of Banks' Best Bitter.") AddToInventory (Growler) MakeObjectInvisible (Hungover Cooper) MakeObjectVisible (Cured Cooper) MakeObjectInvisible (half made barrels) MakeObjectVisible (made barrels) MakeObjectInvisible (Bloody Mary Cocktail)

object.name: Growler
object.look: A dark brown glass jug containing 3 and 1/3 pints of Bank's Beer, with a screw on metal cap.

giveto.item:
UnlockExit (gates) RemoveObject (Growler) msg ("
The Guard snatches the jug from you, \"Trying to bribe an government official are we?\", \"Hanging offence that you know\".

The Guard looks at the label, \"Banks's, hmm, the good stuff, well I think I deserve a drink, this guard duty is damn tedious, not enough things to stab.\",

He reaches into his pocket, pulls out a key and unlocks the gate.

\"Go on, get going south before I change my mind\"")

output.html:
The Bony King Of Nowhere

by Luke A. Jones

You are in Your Hovel.

You can see Your Dog and a Battered Wooden Chest.

You can go out.


You are in your hovel in the northernmost borderlands of the Kingdom of Nowhere.

It is a round wattle and daub hut. There is a fireplace in the middle with a hole in the thatch roof above it acting as a chimney.

Around the circumference of the room there are a few sticks of furniture and rags that represent the totality of your worldly possessions.

(type 'hints' for game specific help at anytime)


> out

You are in the Northern Meadow.

You can see Your Dog.

You can go in or south.


You are in the meadow outside your hovel, several acres of wild grassland and wild flowers. You may be dirt poor, but the beauty of the landscape is some consolation.

As you step out of your home there is a beating of wings above your head, looking up you see a pigeon rapidly disappearing out of sight, and a letter flutters to your feet, you pick it up.

On the wind you can hear a distant shout of what sounds like "Fuck yooouuuu..." coming from the pigeon's direction before it disappears from sight.
